The field is validated as the user enters a value. When the value is invalid, the
. The value will only be shown to be invalid after that field loses focus. As soon as the the value becomes valid again,
, and the value will be shown to be valid again.
Due to the above behavior, we recommend against using a validator on the final field of a

children.value: handler to map error messages to a specific field. Return an object keyed by the field's
to determine where the error is shown.

properties.title: Form submission
properties.description: The error is attached to the first name field.
properties.code:
<Form {...{
  onSubmit: ({current}) => {
      if (current.firstName.startsWith('F')) throw new Error(`First name ${current.firstName} begins with 'F'`);
  },
  onSubmitError: error => error.message.indexOf('First name') > -1 ? {firstName: error.message} : null,
  fields: {
      firstName: {
        initialValue: 'John',
        label: 'First Name',
        help: 'First names beginning with "F" will have errors shown here'
      },
      lastName: {
        initialValue: 'Doe',
        label: 'Last Name'
      }
    }
}}>
{({fields, canSubmit}) => {
  return (
    <Grid>
      <FlexCol>{fields.firstName}</FlexCol>
      <FlexCol>{fields.lastName}</FlexCol>
      <FlexCol className="mtxxxl" fixed><PrimaryButton type="submit" disabled={!canSubmit()}>Submit</PrimaryButton></FlexCol>
    </Grid>
  );
}}
</Form>

children.value: To lay out a single form field without using a whole
component can decorate a field with a label, a tooltip, an "optional" indicator, and help text.
Note that state management and other
features are not handled by the

properties.title: Basic form unit
properties.code: Enter a value in the field above }}>

properties.title: Inline form unit
properties.description: When inline is true, the label will be placed on the same line as the field.

properties.title: Form unit with error
properties.description: When hasError is true, the field border and help text become red to indicate an error.
properties.code:
<FormUnit {...{
    label: 'Username',
    labelFor: 'username-input',
    help: 'Username must be more than 8 characters',
    hasError: true
}}>
  <Input id="username-input" type="text"/>
</FormUnit>

properties.title: Form unit with postLabel
properties.description: The postLabel can contain any node and will be positioned in the top-right corner of a non-inline form unit.
properties.code: alert('Thanks for clicking me!')}>I am a postLabel!, help: 'Username must be more than 8 characters' }}>

properties.title: Form unit with composite field
properties.code:
<FormUnit {...{
    label: 'Table field'
}}>
  <Table data={[
      {name: 'One', enabled: <Checkbox/>},
      {name: 'Two', enabled: <Checkbox/>},
      {name: 'Three', enabled: <Checkbox/>}
  ]}/>
</FormUnit>
